intro: Pilosella halacsyi, commonly known as the Hungarian hairgrass, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to Central and Eastern Europe. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads and daisy-like appearance. The plant features slender, hairy stems and small, greenish-yellow flowers that bloom in the summer months. Pilosella halacsyi typically grows in moist, open habitats such as meadows and grasslands. Its ecological importance lies in its role as a food source for various insects and its contribution to biodiversity in its native range.
